description.narrative: TDA aims to lay the foundation for a durable peace in Syria by strengthening the capacity of key civil society actors and amplifying their voices within policy debates, with a particular focus on transitional justice and rule of law. Founded in 2012 with the objective of preparing for a new post-Assad Syria, TDA has been working to support a transition towards a more stable and democratic Syria and has adapted its support to the Syrian opposition in response to developments in the Syrian conflict. The outcome of the programme is Civil society actors are more representative, better coordinated and amplified, and able bring to discussions cohesive, evidence-based, widely supported recommendations, with an eye on a future transition.The outputs are;Output 1. Targeted CS leaders are reinforced and capable of administering campaigns, holding discussions, open forums and seminars, assisting local groups and building coalitionsOutput 2. Targeted CS leaders, decision makers and other national and international actors are informed about community perceptions and needs on transitional justice issues through TDA surveys.Output 3. Civil society (including women, youth, minorities, and other groups) is coordinated, trained and informed on transitional justice and is included in key policy discussionsOutput 4. The capacities of lawyers, CS leaders and judges to preserve documentation is increased.To achieve its results TDA has adopted a bottom-up and top-down approach: the former aims to strengthen local civil society in Syria through information, capacity building and networking, and the latter provides overall guidance and strategic thinking on the broader elements of a transition in Syria to various stakeholders. TDA currently operates against four lines of activities: civil society campaigns, surveys and focus groups, the safeguarding of documents and support to the Transitional Justice Coordination Group.Over the next three years, TDA will continue to produce surveys to reflect the Syrian public’s perspectives on issues of transition, to coordinate civil society on these issues to become more knowledgeable and credible participants in discussions of transition, and to work on document preservation to avoid escalating conflict in Syria. In this same timeframe, TDA’s Communicators will involve over 60 local Syrian organizations in joint activities aiming to strengthen accountability and rule of law, will lead 18 campaigns that raise awareness around the goals and objectives for a lasting, democratic transition and improved accountability of local power holders to citizens, will build the capacity of local leaders to respond to local concerns.

Detta är ett treårigt programstöd till The Day After på 9 500 000 SEK. The Day After är en syrisk organisation, baserad i Istanbul i Turkiet, som arbetar med kapacitetsbyggande för det syriska civilsamhället, påverkansarbete gentemot internationella samfundet samt genomför studier och säkerställer att dokument angående markrättigheter skyddas för framtida förhandlingar. The Day After samordnar också aktörer inom området övergångsrättvisa. Sida kommer att samstödja programmet med Danmark, Canada och Schweiz.
The Day Afters program ska stärka det syriska civilsamhällets och lokala ledares förmåga att arbeta för demokratisk förändring, inklusive fred och stabilitet. The Day After är en rättighetsbaserad organisation och den arbetar för ett brett deltagande av syriska aktörer i de områden de är aktiva. The Day After kommer att stödja småskalliga initiativ inne i Syrien via olika civil samhälles organisationer och lokala institutioner. Dessa stöd ska vara i linje med The Days Afters mandat och leda till bättre förståelse för fredsbyggande och mänskliga rättigheter. The Day After strävar också efter att kvinnor ska delta i högra grad i de lokala initiativen de stödjer.
The Day Afters program kommer att bidra till att uppnå de målsättningar som fastslagits i den svenska Syrienstrategin: att stärka kapaciteten hos syriska civilsamhällesorganisationer och lokala strukturer att bedriva påverkansarbete, delta i dialog och bidra till freds- och statsbyggnad. The Day After bedöms att ha relevant erfarenhet och kapacitet för att genomföra programmet.

TDA will be supporting civil society communicators to mobilize their communities and lead initiatives that promotes the rule of law and good governance. These activities strengthen the rule of law and build the capacity and experience of local leaders, promote their legitimacy and responsiveness to local concerns, and ensure that civil society leaders reach and include the voices of diverse segments of the Syrian population. For example, TDA’s Communicators will involve over 60 local Syrian organizations in joint activities aiming to strengthen accountability and rule of law. They will lead 18 campaigns that raise awareness around the goals and objectives for a lasting, democratic transition and improved accountability of local power holders to citizens. They will also build the capacity of local leaders to respond to local concerns, and will continue supporting nascent grassroots organisations to implement their ideas, with a particular focus on activities focused on women, minorities, and marginalized groups.

tag.narrative: 1.1 - By 2030, eradicate extreme poverty for all people everywhere, currently measured as people living on less than $1.25 a day.
1.1 - Senast 2030 avskaffa den extrema fattigdomen för alla människor överallt. Med extrem fattigdom avses för närvarande människor som lever på mindre än 1,25 US-dollar per dag.
10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.

10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
16.b - Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
16.b - Verka för och genomdriva icke-diskriminerande lagstiftning och politik för en hållbar utveckling.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation

description.narrative: As stated in reports and statements The Day After has contributed to improved civil society coordination never the least through the Transitional Justice Coordination Group. Strengthened collaboration between Syrian civil society and the International, Impartial and Independent Mechanism, IIIM is also a result. The establishment of Association of Detainees and The Missing in Sednaya Prison is a result of TDA’s support, working with data collection of 100 cases of human rights violations against detention survivors. The founding of this organization can be assessed as a spin-off effect of The Day After’s activities and an unexpected result. TDA’s team of communicators inside Syria also achieved results during the grant period reaching nearly 7,000 Syrians in 837 events in 6 provinces (Aleppo, Idlib, Damascus countryside, Hama, Homs, Daraa, Hasakeh), with at least 40% of beneficiaries being women. 6 advocacy campaigns and dialogue sessions conducted on issues related to transitional justice Women IDPs supported through dialogue sessions on difficulties/challenges faced by them IDP communities informed and supported through various dialogue sessions (topics: concept of civil society, civil registration, women’s rights, amendments to Personal State Law). In the Surveyors Project the perspectives of over 16,000 Syrian men and women have been documented in 12 reports, including: Transitional Justice and Rule of Law, Forced Demographic Changes, Discrimination against women and perceptions of women’s rights in Syrian Society, to mention a few. Several events were held parallelly in Turkey and Syria to share and advocate results of these study on widest possible range and to highlight violations on human rights in Syria. Under The Day After project 2,630,300 official documents have been safeguarded (2.2 million court documents, 310,000 property registries, 120,000 court documents and 300 ledgers) all gathered across four different Syrian provinces.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
